1.title: Doug Mahnke
1.plot: Features Green Lantern and JLA artist Doug Mahnke.

2.title: Dirk Manning and Unshaven Comics
2.plot: Independent double feature. Featuring "Write -or- Wrong" and "Nightmare World" writer Dirk Manning. "Mystery Guest of the Week" (MGotW) takes the week off and in its place is "Indy Ink" with our guests from Unshaven Comics.

3.title: Rod Reis and Ken Rocafort
3.plot: The double feature is "Aquaman" and "Justice League of America" colorist, Rod Reis and "Superman" artist, Ken Rocafort. Mystery Guest of the Week (MGotW) returns this week.

4.title: Amanda Conner
4.plot: Our guest Amanda Conner (Silk Spectre, Power Girl, Painkiller Jane and The Pro) had so much to say that her interview takes up the entire episode. All recorded at C2E2 in 2013.

5.title: Len Wein with Musical Guest Government Cheaze
5.plot: Our guest Len Wein (Swamp Thing, Incredible Hulk, Batman) talks about his current work on Before Watchmen Ozymandias and we look back at his career. Government Cheaze invades with a music montage in photos of Wizard World Philly.

6.title: Mico Suayan
6.plot: We look into Mico Suayan's (Red Hood and the Outlaws, Moon Knight) inspiration and some of his future cover work. MGotW returns for and we give you a peek at our future guests.

7.title: Scott Allie
7.plot: Dark Horse comics editor-in-chief, Scott Allie. He talks about his experience with Hellboy, Microsoft's Halo and a new project from Lucas Films. Recorded at C2E2 in 2013.

8.title: Brian Azzarello with Musical Guest Government Cheaze
8.plot: Please welcome Brian Azzarello (100 Bullets, Wonder Woman). What is to come with his take on Wonder Woman in the New 52? Government Cheaze invades with a music montage in photos of Wizard World New York City 2013.

9.title: Jimmy Palmiotti and Part 1 Dirk Manning's Write-or-Wrong
9.plot: Jimmy Palmiotti's All Star Western featuring Jonah Hex puts him in Gotham City. How does it impact the Batman books? Part 1 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

10.title: Chris Burnham and Part 2 Dirk Manning's Write-or-Wrong
10.plot: Calling all Batman Fans. Chris Burnham covers the death of Damian Wayne and all things "Bats". Also part 2 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

11.title: Phil Hester and Part 3 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
11.plot: Writer and artist Phil Hester. He talks about developing as an artist and his current work with Image Comics. Also Part 3 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

12.title: Christopher Jones and Part 4 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
12.plot: Interviews the very animated Christopher Jones (Young Justice, The Batman Strikes). Also part 4 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

13.title: Eric Powell and Part 5 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
13.plot: The Goon Guru himself, Eric Powell (The Goon, Marvel Monsters). Also part 5 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

14.title: Skottie Young and Part 6 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
14.plot: Master of the comic cherubs, Skottie Young (Marvel baby variant covers, Marvel Oz Books). Also part 6 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

15.title: Kevin McNally and Part 7 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
15.plot: Calling Kevin McNally (Pirates of the Caribbean, Turn) on deck. Hear the stories directly from the drunken sailor. Also part 7 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

16.title: Greg Horn and Part 8 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
16.plot: Greg Horn (Marvel War of Heroes, Marvel Covers, DC Covers). Also part 8 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

17.title: Blue Nemesis Takes Over Creative Continuity
17.plot: Transmission has been taken over by the creators of Blue Nemesis, James Maddox and Stephen B. Scott.

18.title: Stephen B. Scott and Part 9 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
18.plot: Stephen B. Scott solo interview from Motor City. He gives some tips and tricks to being a comic artist. Also part 9 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

19.title: Batman Arkham Origins Special Edition
19.plot: Arkham Origins is about to break loose. Eric Holmes lends some insight to this prequel. Troy Baker relives his boyhood dream to be the voice of an iconic villain. Roger Craig Smith tells us how he prepares to become the Batman.

20.title: Tyler Kirkham and Part 10 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
20.plot: Tyler Kirkham (Green Lantern Corps, Tomb Raider, Darkness/Superman) will share some war stories from Sector 2814. Also part 10 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists".

21.title: Duane Swierczynski and Part 11 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
21.plot: Get your detective skills on with Duane Swierczynski. Part 11 of Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists" - Q and A.

22.title: Pere Perez and Part 12 Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong
22.plot: Dive in deep with Pere Perez's run on Batgirl. Also the final part in Dirk Manning's Write -or- Wrong series titled "The Ten Commandments of Successfully Working with Artists" of 2013.

23.title: Stan Lee and Justice League: War
23.plot: Stan Lee comes to "Creative Continuity". Nuff said. "Justice League: War" Producer James Tucker and Casting Director Andrea Romano give us the behind the scenes story on the making of this new direct-to-video animated superhero film.

24.title: Lou Ferrigno and Walter Koenig
24.plot: Hulk out with Incredible Hulk actor and fitness guru Lou Ferrigno. All hands report to the flight deck. Pavel Andreievich Chekov (AKA Walter Koenig) has the com.

25.title: Edward James Olmos
25.plot: We interview Edward James Olmos. We span his career including Miami Vice, Battlestar Galactica and Blade Runner.

26.title: David Finch
26.plot: "Forever Evil" artist David Finch. Recorded at Baltimore Comic Con.

27.title: Ray Fawkes and Kevin Bolk
27.plot: Ray Fawkes (Justice League Dark, Constantine, Pandora) talks about his current run on the "dark side". Indy Ink is back with artist Kevin Bolk.

28.title: Mike Mignola and Paul Harding
28.plot: Episode 28, Season 1, of "Creative Continuity" travels to hell to get the news directly from Hellboy creator Mike Mignola. We also do a little playtime with toy and bust sculptor, Paul Harding. Recorded at Baltimore Comic Con.

29.title: J. M. DeMatteis and Bob McLeod
29.plot: We bring you up to speed on the story of the Phantom Stranger from J. M. DeMatteis. Following up with inker, artist and co-creator of the New Mutants, Bob McLeod.

30.title: Herb Trimpe
30.plot: We spend quite some time with classic artist Herb Trimpe. We cover his career including before Marvel, dealing with the draft and the Marvel bankruptcy in the 90s. Recorded at Baltimore Comic Con.

31.title: Mark Waid
31.plot: This one is for the law-books as Daredevil scribe, Mark Waid, takes you through his modern works. Recorded at Baltimore Comic Con. Also catch a sneak peek of NYCC episodes, coming soon.

32.title: Mac Walters and Round Table with the Starz Tom Riley David S. Goyer
32.plot: Episode 31, Season 1 of "Creative Continuity" puts SSV Normandy to dock on the Citadel as commander Mac Walters gives us the scoop to space exploration. Writer to BioWare's Mass Effect 2, 3 and 4 games as well as Dark Horse Comics Mass Effect: Foundation. The Premiere of Round Table with the Starz features Actor Tom Riley (Leonardo Da Vinci) and Creator/Writer/EP David S. Goyer on season 2 of Starz original series, "Da Vinci's Demons". Finally some departing words with "Antiques roadshow" appraiser of collectibles, Gary Sohmers. All recorded at New York Comic Con. ...

33.title: Greg Pak and Round Table with the Starz Gregg Chillin Laura Haddock
33.plot: Greg Pak brings us around to his transition from film to comics. Round Table with the Starz features actor Gregg Chillin and actress Laura Haddock on season 2 of Starz original series, "Da Vinci's Demons".

34.title: Nicola Scott and Round Table with the Starz Ronald D Moore Diana Gabaldon
34.plot: Nicola Scott brings her talents from Sidney, Australia and dishes on Wonder Woman, and other DC titles. Round Table with the Starz features producer Ronald D Moore and author Diana Gabaldon on Starz adaptation of the novel, "Outlander".

35.title: Derek Fridolfs and Round Table with the Starz Blake Ritson Carolina Guerra
35.plot: Multi-talented Derek Fridolfs talks about his adventures with Batman. Including his works on Arkham Unhinged, Streets of Gotham and Lil Gotham. Round Table with the Starz features Blake Ritson and Carolina Guerra from "Da Vincis Demons".

36.title: Joshua Williamson and Andrew Anderson
36.plot: Joshua Williamson talks Voodoo, Ghosted and the future of the Aliens/Predator/Prometheus comic book franchise. Andrew "the Reinforcer" Anderson, shares his origins and involvement with "Behind the Ropes".

37.title: Joshua Hale Fialkov and Peter David
37.plot: Joshua Hale Fialkov gives us an intensive overview in his career writing and publishing comic both independently and professionally. Peter David talks books and comics.

38.title: Cliff Chiang and Dan Parent
38.plot: Cliff Chiang reveals the ultimate Wonder Woman cover-up. The bus stops in Riverdale to pick up Dan Parent. Catch up with Archie, Jughead, Betty, Veronica and the rest of the gang.

39.title: Mahmud A. Asrar and Dustin Nguyen
39.plot: Mahmud A. Asrar covers his work from Supergirl to Marvel comics. What inspired Dustin Nguyen when growing up? Get the scoop on the bat books as well as Li'l Gotham.

40.title: John Stanisci and Billy West
40.plot: We get to know what artistic changes are in store for John Stanisci. Billy West gives some pointers in voice acting. Finally some EXTENDED departing words with "Antiques roadshow" appraiser of collectibles, Gary Sohmers.

100.title: 10k Views - Annie Wu EXCLUSIVE
100.plot: A special episode for passing the 10k view benchmark. It includes an exclusive interview with artist Annie Wu (Hawkeye, Batman Beyond: Batgirl Beyond, Ms Marvel) as well as a small peak into season 2.

104.title: Tom Riley & David S Goyer: Round Table

1.title: Tony Bedard, Emanuela Lupacchino and Frank Cho
1.plot: Writer Tony Bedard and artist Emanuela Lupacchino as they share their own separate creative processes to create red lantern Supergirl. Frank Cho tells why he put Shanna the She-Devil in his 2013 run of Savage Wolverine.

2.title: Simone Bianchi and High Fructose Zombies
2.plot: Get to know Italian illustrator Simone Bianchi. Indy Ink returns with a helping of High Fructose Zombies. Written and drawn by husband and wife combo, David Phillips and Sarah Braly.

3.title: Peter David and Dirk Manning RETURNS
3.plot: Peter David discusses his involvement to the new Spider-man 2099 as well as his 12 year run on the Incredible Hulk. Coming to the east cost for the first time is Dirk Manning. What is in store for Tales of Mister Rhee?

4.title: Jeff Shultz and Arthur Suydam
4.plot: Betty and Veronica artist Jeff Shultz is interviewed along with the Zombie King, Arthur Suydam.

5.title: Echo Endless and the Comic Book Men
5.plot: Moonbase's own She Hulk of many talents, Echo Endless. Followed by AMC's Comic Book Men, Ming Chen, Mike Zapcic and Bryan Johnson. Podcasting, Movies and signs - Oh - err - WOW.

6.title: Jim Cheung, J.G. Jones and Jason David Frank
6.plot: The Marvel-ous Jim Cheung covers his work on Avengers vs. X-men, Infinity and Axis. J.G. Jones goes over his inspiration on becoming a comic-book artist. Jason David Frank, talks about his work with Bat in the Sun.

New York City, New York, USA::(New York Comic Con)
imdb.plot outline: Ever want to go to New York Comic Con or any big Comic Con but couldn't get find the time? Relax! We bring the convention to you! Creative Continuity has been providing access to comic book writers, artists and even a few celebrities. Recorded on location from various Comic Cons. Stay tuned for our original series produced by Bestow Productions.
imdb.title: Creative Continuity
plot: _Creative Continuity_ (qv) has been providing access to comic book writers, artists and even a few celebrities. Recorded on location from various Comic Cons.::Paul Sanders

Ever want to go to New York Comic Con or any big Comic Con but couldn't get find the time? Relax! We bring the convention to you! _Creative Continuity_ (qv) has been providing access to comic book writers, artists and even a few celebrities. Recorded on location from various Comic Cons. Stay tuned for our original series produced by Bestow Productions.::Paul Sanders
